Module no.ntnu.idatx2001.newsstand
Package no.ntnu.idata2001.wargames.ui.controllers

Class MainWindowAppController

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idata2001.wargames.ui.controllers.MainWindowAppController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainWindowAppController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable

The main controller of the application. This controller will be the "glue" between the GUI and the underlying business logic. Hence it is the responsibility of this class to create the instance of the Battle-class, and initialize the instance.

The class implements the Initializable interface, which defines the initialize()-method, replacing the constructor. The initialize()-method is being called by the JavaFX runtime upon initialization of the GUI, after the GUI-components in the Scenegraph has been created.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the table-view UI-element, and retrieves the battle from saved file if available. Initializes observableList observableArmyOne and observableList observableArmyTwo for use in the table-view.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - TODO research and add Comment Here.
      resourceBundle - TODO research and add Comment Here.

    • addArmyUnitArmyOne

      public void addArmyUnitArmyOne()
      Display the input dialog to get input to create a new Unit in armyOne. If the user confirms creating a new unit, a new instance of Unit is created and added to armyOne battle-class.

    • addArmyUnitArmyTwo

      public void addArmyUnitArmyTwo()
      Display the input dialog to get input to create a new Unit in armyTwo. If the user confirms creating a new unit, a new instance of Unit is created and added to armyTwo battle-class.

    • deleteArmyUnit

      public void deleteArmyUnit()
      Deletes the Unit selected in the table. If no Unit is selected, nothing is deleted, and the user is informed that he/she must select which Unit to delete.

    • simulate

      public void simulate() throws IOException
      If the terrain is chosen, it starts the simulation. If the terrain is null, it will not do anything.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onHills

      public void onHills()
      To be called when the terrain 'Hills' is chosen.

    • onPlains

      To be called when the terrain 'Plains' is chosen.

    • onForest

      public void onForest()
      To be called when the terrain 'Forest' is chosen.

    • terrainChoiceCase

      public void terrainChoiceCase()
      Adds resistBonus and attackBonus the Cavalry, Commander, Infantry and Ranged-Units in the battle-class. If the set terrain is not 'Hills', 'Plains', 'Forest' or null, there will ve thrown an IllegalArgumentException to the terminal. TODO make Exception to logger.log.

    • editUnit

      public void editUnit()
      Edit the selected unit.

    • showUnitDetails

      public void showUnitDetails()
      Show details of the selected unit.

    • unitDialog

      public void unitDialog(boolean editable)
      unit dialog with boolean editable shows details about the units, edits units or adds unit. If unit not given it will show new Unit dialog, if unit given, its editable if boolean set to editable.
      Parameters:
      editable - true if unit should be editable false is not.

    • chooseTerrainType

      public void chooseTerrainType() throws IOException
      Displays a confirmation dialog for choosing the terrain if the user have not already chosen terrain .
      Throws:
      IOException

    • save

      public void save() throws IOException
      Saves battle to Battle.bin-file using fileController. Throws IOException if writing failed.
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing to Battla.csv-file fails.

    • exit

      public void exit() throws IOException
      TODO: make filecontroller in the initialize or the contstructor. this.filecontroller. Exit the application. Displays a confirmation dialog.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • showAboutDialog

      public void showAboutDialog()
      Displays an example of an alert (info) dialog. In this case an "about" type of dialog.

    • export

      public void export()
      Exports file as .csv-file. Shows choose- folder-dialog.

    • open

      public void open()
      Displays the file chooser dialog. Nothing is done with the file chosen by the user. For demo-purposes only.

    • resetSession

      public void resetSession() throws IOException
      Resets the armies from memory. Calls for new Random() to make the battle different each time.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FileController if memory file is corrupted.

    • selectedArmyTwo

      public void selectedArmyTwo()
      Unselects armyTwo selection when armyOne unit is selected.

    • selectedArmyOne

      public void selectedArmyOne()
      Unselects armyOne selection when armyTwo unit is selected.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Removes all the units in both armies.

    • openDialog

      public File openDialog()
      Opens file-chooser dialog where user selects file to be opened as .csv file.
      Returns:
      open .csv-file dialog.
